    IC-diagnostics IC-introduction IC-precision IC-process IC-read

    Function reference

    Reading ion count data

    Checking files, and loading ion count data and associated meta-data.

    ICdir_chk()
    Check if directory is suitable for point
    point_example()
    Get path to point example
    read_IC() read_meta()
    Read raw ion count data
    unfold() fold()
    Access and hide IC metadata

    Correcting ion count data

    Functions to correct pulsed ion coun data for systematic machine-induced biases.

    cor_IC()
    Process raw ion count data
    cor_yield() cor_DT()
    Correct ion detection bias
    QSA_test()
    QSA test
    predict_ionize()
    Predicting trends in ionization efficiency
    zeroCt()
    Remove analytical runs with zero counts

    Analysing ion count data

    Functions to calculate internal and external precision of pulsed ion count data of single ions and ion ratios.

    stat_X() stat_R()
    Analyse raw ion count data
    stat_SDprop()
    Propagation of errors for isotope ratios

    Diagnostics of ion count data

    Functions to check for internal consistency of ion count ratio data; enabling detection of isotopic variability in the analyte.

    diag_R()
    Diagnostics isotope count data
    Cameca() CooksD() CV() Rm() norm_E() QQ() IR()
    Family of diagnostics functions for isotope count ratios
    eval_diag()
    Evaluate effect size and significance of outliers on R
    formula_parser()
    Linear model parser

    Miscellaneous tools to handle ion count data

    Functions for easy plotting and printing of ion count data.

    cov_R()
    Function for co-variate conversion of isotope systems
    ion_labeller() R_labeller() stat_labeller()
    Chemical species names for plots and tables
    twodens()
    Plotting highly dens data (inspired by Thomas Mock)

    Helpers for isotope systematics

    Converting between relative and absoluate isotope abudance and delta notation.

    calib_R()
    Calibration of isotope ratios
    reference_R
    The reference materials used for common isotope systems after the USGS)

    Datasets

    Real and simulated data as well as information on methods

    names_cameca
    The data associated with Cameca NanoSIMS 50L
    names_model
    The regression model names associated with point::diag_R()
    names_plot
    The plot types for diagnostic tests available in point
    names_stat_R
    The statistics associated with point::stat_R()
    names_stat_X
    The statistics associated with point::stat_X()
    simu_IC
    Simulated ion count dataset
    simu_R()
    Simulate ion count data
    cameca_stat_R
    Reference Cameca R statistics
    cameca_stat_X
    Reference Cameca X statistics
    real_IC
    Real ion count dataset
    point
    point: A package for reading, processing, and analysing raw ion count data.
